Events that occurred on 18 April.

content.title: On Earth
content.content:
1917 - J.R.R. Tolkien and Christopher Wiseman, the Great Twin Brethren, meet in Harrogate, and discuss the fate of the Barrovians and the future of the Society.
1930 - Voice actor Clive Revill is born.
1944 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 61.
1945 - Amateur cartographer Karen Wynn Fonstad is born.
1955 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 162.
1955 - Grant Major is born.
1963 - J.R.R. Tolkien starts writing a letter to Mr. and Mrs. Kloos.
1984 - Voice actor Francis de Wolff dies.
2007 - The fourth and final day of The Children of HÃºrin Release Party is hosted by Tolkien Gateway.

content.title: In Arda
content.content: There are no known events for this day.
